Definition: In this task your given two statements. You must judge whether the second sentence is the cause or effect of the first one. Label the instances as "cause" or "effect" based on your judgment. The sentences are separated by a newline character.

Positive Examples.input:
The women met for coffee.
They wanted to catch up with each other.
Positive Examples.explanation: The women met for coffee because they wanted to catch up with each other.

Positive Examples.input:
The physician misdiagnosed the patient.
The patient filed a malpractice lawsuit against the physician.
Positive Examples.explanation: The patience filed a lawsuit against the physician is the effect of the physician misdiagnosing him/her.

Positive Examples.input:
The guests of the party hid behind the couch.
It was a surprise party.
Positive Examples.explanation: The guests hid behind the couch because it was a surprise party.

Positive Examples.input:
My friend was recovering from surgery.
I brought her a card and flowers.

Negative Examples.input:
My body cast a shadow over the grass.
The sun was rising.
Negative Examples.explanation: The rising of the sun isn't an effect of casting a shadow over the grass.

Negative Examples.input:
I took antibiotics.
My infection cleared up.
Negative Examples.explanation: clearing up infection is the effect of taking antibiotics and it can't be the reason of that. So, the output should be effect.
